intro: Gaultheria antioquiensis, commonly known as the Antioquian wintergreen, is a species of shrub native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by bright red berries in the fall. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Gaultheria antioquiensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also used in traditional medicine.
